ground_truth: They stare at him, followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries, which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again, pulling off his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a two-lane highway, bordered by snowfields, carrying one moving car, which is driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises and, as he leaves, the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits, staring at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, having sex with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away, and calls before someone takes the phone. Jerry wanders through the service area, where cars are being worked on, and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out front and smokes, gazing out the window. He is driving and on the phone. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone, which pops out of her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty, and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jerry enters the kitchen wearing a parka and red plaid hat, placing groceries on the counter. Wade Gustafson, in his sixties with gray hair, is present. An aerial view shows Carl Showalter driving on a snowy highway. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look. Jerry, in his sales cubicle, faces an irate couple, then leaves as they watch. Carl and Grimsrud are in twin beds with truck-stop hookers. A woman calls on the phone before someone else takes it. Jerry stops by an Indian inspecting a car. Carl drives while Grimsrud smokes. She opens a high window, stepping up from the toilet. The door knob falls, and Grimsrud and Carl enter the empty room with an open window. Carl exits through the window. Grimsrud searches the medicine cabinet, notices the drawn shower curtain, and reaches for it. The curtain bursts open as Jean, tangled, screams and stumbles into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: They fix their gaze intently upon him, followed by an awkward pause, as Jerry makes his entrance through the kitchen door. He is clad in a warm parka and a distinctive red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, and he carries a bag filled with groceries, which he promptly places on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters once more, this time removing his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, who is in his mid-sixties, appears vigorous and full of life, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial view of a two-lane highway, bordered by expansive snowfields, with a single moving car driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud casts a sour look at Carl, followed by a prolonged pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at him. Jerry finds himself seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, which is situated just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises from his seat, and as he departs, the couple watches him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits down again, staring at his lap in contemplation. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, engaging in intimate activities with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away from her ear, and calls out before someone else takes the phone from her. Jerry meanders through the service area, where various cars are being worked on, and he stops by an Indian man dressed in blue jeans, who is examining the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out the front window, smoking and gazing at the passing scenery. He continues to drive while talking on the phone. A morning-show host, wearing an apron, stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut with a loud bang. Jean, sobbing uncontrollably, frantically pushes at the buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free from the wall. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back nervously as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door comes to an end as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open with a creak, moving as one piece within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is empty, and the window stands open. Carl strides purposefully to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, searching for the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it suddenly explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Their eyes become fixated on him with an intense gaze, which is followed by an awkward silence, as Jerry strides confidently through the entrance of the kitchen door. He is dressed warmly in a cozy parka and topped with a distinctive red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, holding a bag brimming with groceries, which he immediately places on the kitchen counter with a casual familiarity. Jerry makes another entrance, this time taking off his plaid cap, and Wade Gustafson, a man in his mid-sixties, who exudes vitality and vigor, with a full head of gray hair, stands nearby. A twisting aerial perspective dramatically reveals a sprawling two-lane highway, bordered on either side by vast, expansive snowfields, with a solitary car being driven by Carl Showalter venturing along its path. Grimsrud directs a sour look towards Carl, succeeded by a lengthy pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly, almost vacantly, at him. Jerry finds himself seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, strategically positioned just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. Rising from his seat, Jerry departs, and the couple observes him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. He settles back into his chair, staring contemplatively at his lap, lost in thought. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud find themselves in twin beds, engaged in intimate activities with two truck-stop hookers. Elsewhere, a woman picks up the phone, holds it away from her ear to call out to someone, and then hands the phone over to another person. Jerry meanders through the active service area, where a variety of cars are being worked on, and stops by an Indian man, who is dressed in blue jeans, and is examining the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light hanging precariously off it. Carl is at the wheel, driving, while Grimsrud stares pensively out the front window, smoking and taking in the passing scenery. He continues to drive while engaging in a conversation on the phone. A cheerful morning-show host, adorned in an apron, stands behind a counter on a well-designed kitchen set. Jean carefully sets down her coffee cup and rises to her feet, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut with a loud, echoing bang. Jean, now sobbing uncontrollably, frantically jabs at the buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her grasp, clatters noisily across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free from the wall in a sudden snap. Jean crosses over to a high window above the toilet, throwing it open and glancing back nervously as she steps cautiously up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door gradually comes to an end as the wood surrounding its knob splinters apart, causing the knob itself to tumble onto the floor. The door swings open with a loud creak, moving as one cohesive piece within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is conspicuously empty, and the window is wide open. Carl strides purposefully to the window and hoists himself out with determination. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet with careful precision, delicately tapping aside various bottles and tubes as he searches for the appropriate unguent. He locates a salve but sets it down after noticing something reflected in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it suddenly bursts outward with a violent motion, animated by thrashing limbs, and Jean screams, tangled messily in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling clumsily out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They fix their gaze on him, creating a moment of awkward silence as Jerry steps through the kitchen door, clad in a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, while carrying a bag of groceries. He moves with purpose to the kitchen counter, where he places the bag down. Jerry re-enters the scene, this time removing his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, a man in his mid-sixties with a vigorous demeanor and a full head of gray hair, is present. The perspective shifts dramatically to reveal an aerial view of a two-lane highway, flanked by expansive snowfields, with a single car in motion, driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud casts a sour look at Carl, followed by a prolonged pause as Gaear Grimsrud fixes a blank stare on Carl. Jerry is seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, positioned just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He stands up and, as he exits, the couple's eyes follow him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. Jerry then sits down, directing his gaze towards his lap. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, engaged in sexual activity with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it at a distance, and calls out before someone else takes the phone from her. Jerry meanders through the service area, where various cars are undergoing repairs, and pauses beside an Indian man in blue jeans who is inspecting the underside of a car elevated on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light dangling from it. Carl is behind the wheel, while Grimsrud, smoking, stares out the front window, lost in thought. Carl continues to drive while simultaneously talking on the phone. A morning-show host, wearing an apron, stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean places her coffee cup down and stands up, and as two men enter, a door on the far side slams shut. In a state of panic, Jean, sobbing, frantically presses buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her grasp, clatters across the tile floor, crashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord snapping free. Jean moves to a high window above the toilet, throws it open, and glances back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ceases as the wood around its knob splinters, causing the knob to fall to the floor. The door swings open with a creak, moving as a single unit within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is vacant, and the window stands open. Carl strides over to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet, carefully nudging aside various bottles and tubes in search of the right ointment. He locates a salve but sets it down after catching sight of something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it bursts outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, entangled in the curtain, tearing it from its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: They stare at him awkwardly as Jerry enters the kitchen, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, and places a bag of groceries on the counter. Jerry re-enters, removing his cap, while Wade Gustafson, a vigorous man in his mid-sixties with a full head of gray hair, is present. An aerial shot reveals a two-lane highway bordered by snowfields, with Carl Showalter driving the only moving car. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, followed by a long pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at him. Jerry, in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle off the showroom floor, faces an irate customer and his wife. He rises, and as he leaves, the couple watches him enter a nearby cubicle, where he sits, staring at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, calls out, and hands it over. Jerry wanders through the service area, stopping by an Indian in blue jeans inspecting a car on a hydraulic lift. Carl drives while Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises as two men enter, causing a door to slam shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically dials on a princess phone, which slips from her hands, crashes against the door, and bounces away with its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet, opens it, and steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The door groans as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob falls out. The door swings open as Grimsrud and Carl enter the empty room with an open window. Carl strides to the window and climbs out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet, taps aside bottles and tubes, and finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it bursts outward with Jean's thrashing limbs, causing her to scream and stumble into the bedroom, tangled in the curtain.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They stare at him, followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door of his suburban home in Minnesota, known for its cold winters, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat reminiscent of the character from the Looney Tunes cartoons, and carries a bag of groceries from the local Piggly Wiggly store, which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again, pulling off his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, a seasoned businessman known in local real estate circles, is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a two-lane highway in the rural expanses of North Dakota, bordered by snowfields, carrying one moving car driven by Carl Showalter, a small-time criminal entangled in a kidnapping plot. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, a frequent gesture of his abrasive personality, followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle at Gustafson Motors, just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife, who are upset about a fraudulent deal. He rises and, as he leaves, the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits, staring at his lap, pondering the mess he's caught in. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, having sex with two truck-stop hookers from a roadside diner off Interstate 29. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away, and calls for assistance before someone takes the phone. Jerry wanders through the service area of the dealership, where cars are being worked on by skilled mechanics, and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out front and smokes, gazing out the window at the whitewashed landscape. He is driving and on the phone, likely negotiating yet another shady transaction. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set, filming a segment about local recipes. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut, echoing through the small cabin. Jean, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone, a design popular in the 1960s, which pops out of her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free in her panic. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank, seeking escape. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters under pressure, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty, and the window is open, flapping in the wind. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out, escaping into the cold. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent for a forgotten injury. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: They stare at him followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again pulling off his plaid cap while Wade Gustafson is midsixtyish vigorous with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a twolane highway bordered by snowfields carrying one moving car which is driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassedin salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises and as he leaves the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits staring at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds having sex with two truckstop hookers. A woman picks up the phone holds it away and calls before someone takes the phone. Jerry wanders through the service area where cars are being worked on and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving while Grimsrud stares out front and smokes gazing out the window. He is driving and on the phone. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. A morningshow host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises and as the two men enter a door at the far side slams shut. Jean sobbing frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone which pops out of her hands jangles across the tile floor smashes against the door and bounces away its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror. the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward. animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams tangled in the curtain ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat stares at the tree, followed by an awkward beat as the dog enters through the kitchen door, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries, which the dog deposits on the kitchen counter. The dog enters again, pulling off its plaid cap, while the horse is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a two-lane highway, bordered by snowfields, carrying one moving car, which is driven by the bird. The rabbit gives the bird a sour look, followed by a long beat as the fox stares blankly at the bird. The monkey sits in its glassed-in salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. The bear wanders through the service area, where cars are being worked on, and stops by a kangaroo in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. The bird is driving, while the fox stares out front and smokes, gazing out the window. The panda is driving and on the phone. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. The giraffe sets down its coffee cup and rises, and as the two turtles enter, a door at the far side slams shut. The elephant, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone, which pops out of its hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free. The elephant crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back as it steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as the fox and the bird enter. The room is empty, and the window is open. The dolphin strides to the window and hoists itself out. The zebra opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent. It finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As it reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as the bear screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They stare at him, followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the dining room door, wearing a windbreaker and a green plaid beret and carries a stack of newspapers, which he deposits on the dining table. Jerry enters again, pulling off his plaid hat, while Wade Gustafson is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a winding river, bordered by cornfields, carrying one drifting boat, which is navigated by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassed-in accountant's cubicle just off the office lobby, facing an irate client and his partner. He rises and, as he leaves, the duo watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits, staring at his shoes. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin hammocks, having ice cream with two carnival performers. A woman picks up the remote, holds it away, and calls before someone takes the remote. Jerry wanders through the storage area, where bicycles are being assembled, and stops by an Italian in khakis who is looking at the frame of a bicycle on a workbench with a flashlight hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out front and munches, gazing out the window. He is driving and on the walkie-talkie. A morning-show host in a chef's hat stands behind a counter on a living room set. Jean sets down her water bottle and rises, and as the two men enter, a window at the far side slams shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on an old computer, which pops out of her hands, skids across the carpeted floor, smashes against the bookshelf, and bounces away, its cable ripped free. Jean crosses to a high bookshelf above the dresser and throws it open, glancing back as she steps up from the dresser to the top shelf. The groaning of the window ends as the glass around its latch shatters, and the latch itself falls out onto the floor. The window swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty, and the bookshelf is open. Carl strides to the bookshelf and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the wardrobe and delicately taps aside various hangers and clothes, seeking the proper garment. He finds a scarf but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is draped over the wardrobe. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the hallway.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They glare at him, followed by an awkward pause as Jerry slips through the kitchen door, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and juggles a bag of groceries, which he tosses on the kitchen counter. Jerry slips again, tossing off his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson is mid-sixtyish, energetic, with a full head of gray hair. A spinning perspective reveals a bird's-eye view of a two-lane highway, bordered by snowfields, bearing one moving car, which is operated by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a dismissive look, followed by a short pause as Gaear Grimsrud glances blankly at Carl. Jerry lingers in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor, facing an annoyed customer and his wife. He descends and, as he vanishes, the couple observes him slip into a nearby cubicle. Jerry lingers, glancing at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, having a pillow fight with two truck-stop hookers. A woman glances at the phone, holds it aside, and shouts before someone grabs the phone. Jerry drifts through the service area, where cars are being painted, and pauses by an Indian in blue jeans who is peering at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light dangling off it. Carl is napping, while Grimsrud peers out front and smokes, scanning out the window. He is napping and on the phone. A morning-show host in an apron lounges behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean places down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men exit, a door at the far side swings shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically jabs at buttons on the princess phone, which slips out of her hands, skitters across the tile floor, crashes against the door, and rolls away, its cord yanked free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and slams it open, glancing back as she hops up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door halts as the wood around its knob splits, and the knob itself tumbles out onto the floor. The door swings open and moans, sitting as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl shuffle in. The room is silent, and the window is open. Carl storms to the window and vaults himself out. Grimsrud inspects the medicine cabinet and gently shifts aside various bottles and tubes, inspecting the proper unguent. He picks up a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is wrapped around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it erupts outward, animated by flailing limbs as Jean shrieks, entwined in the curtain, dragging it off its rings and stumbling out into the hallway.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They gaze at the lamp, followed by an awkward beat as a mailbox enters through the library window, wearing a suitcase and a blue striped pirate hat and carries a stack of envelopes, which it deposits on the piano bench. The mailbox enters again, pulling off its striped scarf, while a telephone booth is mid-fortyish, energetic, with a full head of green leaves. A spinning perspective reveals an aerial shot of a four-lane racetrack, bordered by deserts, carrying one floating bicycle, which is pedaled by a canary. A suitcase gives the canary a displeased glare, followed by a long pause as a candleholder stares blankly at the canary. A mailbox sits in its closed-off gardener's box just off the patio floor, facing a cheerful sunflower and its leaf. It rises and, as it departs, the bouquet watches it go into a nearby box. The mailbox sits, staring at its paws. A canary and a candleholder are in twin cribs, playing chess with two rooftop squirrels. A giraffe picks up the chalkboard, holds it away, and sings before someone takes the megaphone. The mailbox strolls through the dining room, where clocks are being adjusted, and stops by a giraffe in pajamas who is gazing at the underside of a kite on a metal rack with a paperclip hanging off it. The canary is flying, while a candleholder stares out front and doodles, peering out the window. It is flying and on the intercom. A farmer in a raincoat stands behind a fence on a mountain set. A raccoon sets down its apple and rises, and as the two pears enter, a bookcase at the far side slams shut. A raccoon, laughing, frantically pushes at keys on the typewriter, which pops out of its grasp, jingles across the wooden floor, smashes against the closet, and skips away, its ribbon torn free. A raccoon hops to a tall ceiling above the ottoman and throws it open, glancing back as it hops up from the ottoman surface to the rug. The groaning of the wardrobe ends as the metal around its hinge shatters, and the hinge itself falls out onto the rug. The cabinet swings open and groans, moving as one entity in its case as a candleholder and canary exit. The house is vacant, and the skylight is ajar. A canary strides to the skylight and lifts itself out. A candleholder opens the mailbox and delicately nudges aside various spoons and brushes, seeking the proper ointment. It spots a lotion but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the curtain rod is pulled around the alcove. As it reaches for the fabric, it bursts outward, animated by flailing branches as a raccoon shouts, entangled in the fabric, tearing it off its hooks and tumbling out into the hallway.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They gaze at her, followed by an awkward pause as Linda exits through the kitchen door, sporting a poncho and a green plaid hunter's hat and drags a bouquet of flowers, which she places on the kitchen table. Linda exits again, flipping off her plaid hat, while Neil Thompson is mid-seventyish, energetic, with a full head of white hair. A spinning view reveals an overhead shot of a winding dirt road, bordered by cornfields, transporting one moving bike, which is pedaled by Mark Swanson. Anderson gives Mark a disapproving glance, followed by a short pause as Alan Anderson stares blankly at Mark. Linda reclines in her enclosed secretary's booth just off the reception area, facing an annoyed client and his daughter. She stands and, as she departs, the pair observes her enter a nearby booth. Linda reclines, gazing at her shoes. Mark Swanson and Alan Anderson are on separate couches, reading books silently with two coffee shop baristas. A girl picks up the remote, holds it away, and shouts before someone grabs the remote. Linda roams through the showroom area, where bicycles are being repaired, and halts by a teenager in overalls who is examining the engine of a motorcycle on a platform with a work light dangling off it. Mark is pedaling, while Anderson gazes out front and mumbles, staring out the porthole. He is pedaling and texting. A game-show host in a blazer stands beside a podium on a game set. Beth places down her tea mug and stands, and as the two players enter, a door at the near side clicks shut. Beth, weeping, desperately jabs at buttons on the dial phone, which slips out of her hands, slides across the wooden floor, hits against the wall, and rolls away, its cable detached. Beth steps to a small window above the sink and swings it open, looking back as she climbs from the sink to the counter. The creaking of the door ceases as the frame around its handle shatters, and the handle itself falls off onto the carpet. The door swings open and groans, shifting as a single unit in the frame as Anderson and Mark enter. The space is vacant, and the window is open. Mark marches to the window and pulls himself up. Anderson opens the wardrobe and gingerly moves aside various clothes and accessories, searching for the perfect scarf. He finds a belt but sets it down after seeing something in the glass; the shower curtain is pulled across the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it bursts outward, animated by flailing branches as Beth shouts, tangled in the curtain, tearing it off its hooks and staggering out into the hallway.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They gape at him, followed by an awkward pause as Jerry slips through the back gate, wearing a trench coat and a green polka-dotted bowler hat, and holds a bouquet of flowers, which he places on the dining table. Jerry enters again, tearing off his polka-dotted hat, while Wade Gustafson is in his mid-sixties, energetic, with a full beard of gray fur. A rotating view reveals a panoramic shot of a dirt path, bordered by sunlit meadows, holding one galloping horse, which is ridden by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud casts Carl a sweet look, followed by a short pause as Gaear Grimsrud gazes blankly at Carl. Jerry rests in his wooden salesman's hut just off the exhibition space, facing an annoyed patron and his sister. He stands and, as he exits, the pair observes him enter a nearby hut. Jerry rests, gazing at his feet. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are on adjacent couches, playing cards with two carnival performers. A man picks up a spoon, holds it aside, and sings before someone grabs the plate. Jerry meanders through the lounge area, where bicycles are being polished, and pauses by a cowboy in overalls who is inspecting the chain of a bike on a metal stand with a lantern dangling from it. Carl is riding, while Grimsrud peers ahead and coughs, staring through the windshield. He is riding and holding a map. An evening-show chef in a raincoat stands behind a desk on a patio set. Jean sets down her teacup and stands, and as the two women enter, a window on the far wall swings open. Jean, chuckling, gently taps at keys on the calculator, which slips out of her hands, slides across the wooden floor, collides with the chair, and bounces back, its battery popping out. Jean moves to a low window near the refrigerator and pushes it open, glancing back as she steps up from the stepping stool to the sink. The whispering of the window ends as the glass around its frame cracks, and the latch itself drops onto the floor. The window swings shut and rattles, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is vacant, and the door is ajar. Carl strides to the door and lets himself in. Grimsrud opens the wardrobe and gently shifts aside various shoes and hats, searching for the right jacket. He finds a scarf but sets it down after noticing something in the reflection; the blinds are drawn across the window. As he reaches for the blinds, they flash open, animated by waving curtains as Jean laughs, tangled in the drapes, yanking them off their rods and stumbling out onto the balcony.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The elephants gaze at the clown, followed by an awkward tune as Marvin glides through the barn door, sporting a trench coat and a purple striped pirate hat and balances a basket of pineapples, which he places on the barn table. Marvin emerges once more, tossing his striped helmet, while Leo Thompson is mid-forties, energetic, with a head full of curly red fur. A bending angle unveils a bird’s-eye view of a four-lane racetrack, lined by flower fields, transporting one moving cart, which is piloted by Brian Snodgrass. Hegbert throws Brian a sweet grin, followed by a lengthy tune as Ivan Hegbert gazes brightly at Brian. Marvin lounges in his velveted manager's booth adjacent to the gallery space, facing a delighted vendor and her partner. He leaps up and, as he exits, the duo observes him stroll into an adjacent booth. Marvin perches, peering at the ceiling. Brian Snodgrass and Ivan Hegbert are on bunk beds, drawing portraits with two museum guides. A gentleman picks up the trumpet, holds it away, and sings before someone grabs the trumpet. Marvin meanders through the inspection zone, where bicycles are being tuned, and pauses by a giraffe in khakis who is examining the roof of a scooter on a mechanical lift with a fairy lamp dangling from it. Brian is pedaling, while Hegbert peers ahead and whistles, staring out the skylight. He is cycling and on the laptop. An afternoon-talk guest in a bathrobe stands before a shelf on a pantry stage. Sonia sets down her juice glass and hops up, and as the trio arrives, a curtain at the far corner bangs open. Sonia, weeping, hurriedly fiddles with switches on the rotary phone, which slips from her grip, clatters across the carpet, shatters against the wall, and rebounds away, its wire torn loose. Sonia crosses to a tall vent above the bureau and flings it wide, glancing back as she climbs up from the bureau seat to the cabinet. The slamming of the barrier halts as the metal around its lever shatters, and the lever itself drops onto the rug. The barrier swings wide and groans, shifting as a whole within its border as Hegbert and Brian squeeze in. The hall is vacant, and the vent is ajar. Brian saunters to the vent and lifts himself through. Hegbert opens the spice rack and gently nudges aside various jars and tins, searching for the suitable seasoning. He spots a condiment but places it down after glimpsing something in the glass; the shower shade is drawn around the basin. As he reaches for the shade, it bursts outward, animated by flailing fins as Sonia shrieks, stuck in the shade, pulling it off its clips and stumbling out into the lounge.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jerry enters the kitchen in a parka and plaid hat, placing groceries on the counter. Later, he faces an irate customer at his car dealership, before joining Carl and Gaear, who are in twin beds with hookers. Meanwhile, Jean anxiously calls for help but drops the phone, which breaks. She attempts to escape through a high window, but Carl and Grimsrud enter the room. Though the window is open, the room is empty. Carl exits through the window while Grimsrud searches the medicine cabinet, noticing a drawn shower curtain. As he reaches for it, Jean bursts out, tangled in the curtain, and stumbles into the bedroom.

at buttons on the princess phone which pops out of her hands jangles across the tile floor smashes against the door and bounces away its cord ripped free  Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds having sex with two truckstop hookers  They stare at him followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries which he deposits on the kitchen counter  Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes seeking the proper unguent  Jerry wanders through the service area where cars are being worked on and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it  As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward  He rises and as he leaves the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle  Jerry enters again pulling off his plaid cap while Wade Gustafson is midsixtyish vigorous with a
